conclusion: Understanding direction and intensity of light and interaction with objects is necessary.
Shadow A is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow A indicates light source is from the front and slightly to the right.
Shadow B is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow B indicates light source is from the front and slightly to the right.
Shadow C is cast to the right.
Shadow C indicates light source is from the front and slightly to the right.
Shadow D is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow D indicates light source is from the front and slightly to the right.
Light source moves to the back left, changing direction to back and left.
Shadows will shift in the opposite direction due to new light source position.
Shadow A will move to the front and slightly to the left.
Shadow B will move to the front and slightly to the left.
Shadow C will move to the front and slightly to the left.
Shadow D will move to the front and slightly to the left.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the front and slightly to the left.
